description: The h3cStorCriticalLowerTemperatureThresholdNotification indicates
the temperature is lower than the threshold.
If the temperature is lower too much than the entity needs
the entity will halt.

event.Summary: Temperature ($v3) is lower than the threshold ($v4)

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD H3C-STORAGE-MIB::h3cStorCriticalLowerTemperatureThresholdNotification H3C-ENTITY-EXT-MIB::h3cEntityExtPhysicalIndex i 9999 ENTITY-MIB::entPhysicalName s EXAMPLE H3C-ENTITY-EXT-MIB::h3cEntityExtTemperature i 9999 H3C-ENTITY-EXT-MIB::h3cEntityExtCriticalLowerTemperatureThreshold i 9999

description: The index of h3cEntityExtStateTable.
This index is identical to entPhysicalIndex in ENTITY-MIB
variables.name: H3C-ENTITY-EXT-MIB::h3cEntityExtPhysicalIndex

description: The textual name of the physical entity. The value of this
object should be the name of the component as assigned by
the local device and should be suitable for use in commands
entered at the device's `console'. This might be a text
name (e.g., `console') or a simple component number (e.g.
port or module number, such as `1'), depending on the
physical component naming syntax of the device.
If there is no local name, or if this object is otherwise
not applicable, then this object contains a zero-length
string.
Note that the value of entPhysicalName for two physical
entities will be the same in the event that the console
interface does not distinguish between them, e.g., slot-1
and the card in slot-1.
variables.name: ENTITY-MIB::entPhysicalName

description: The temperature for the entity.
variables.name: H3C-ENTITY-EXT-MIB::h3cEntityExtTemperature

description: The threshold for the critical Temperature. When temperature
exceeds the critical lower temperature, a notification will be sent.
variables.name: H3C-ENTITY-EXT-MIB::h3cEntityExtCriticalLowerTemperatureThreshold

description: The h3cStorTemperatureTooLow indicates the temperature is
lower than the threshold.
If the temperature is lower too much than the entity needs
the entity halts now.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD H3C-STORAGE-MIB::h3cStorTemperatureTooLow H3C-ENTITY-EXT-MIB::h3cEntityExtPhysicalIndex i 9999 ENTITY-MIB::entPhysicalName s EXAMPLE H3C-ENTITY-EXT-MIB::h3cEntityExtTemperature i 9999 H3C-ENTITY-EXT-MIB::h3cEntityExtShutdownLowerTemperatureThreshold i 9999

entered at the device's `console'. This might be a text
name (e.g., `console') or a simple component number (e.g.

Note that the value of entPhysicalName for two physical

the raid battery entity's state changes.

description: The index of h3cEntityExtStateTable.
This index is identical to entPhysicalIndex in ENTITY-MIB

description: The textual name of the physical entity. The value of this
object should be the name of the component as assigned by
the local device and should be suitable for use in commands
entered at the device's `console'. This might be a text
name (e.g., `console') or a simple component number (e.g.
port or module number, such as `1'), depending on the
physical component naming syntax of the device.
If there is no local name, or if this object is otherwise
not applicable, then this object contains a zero-length
string.
Note that the value of entPhysicalName for two physical
entities will be the same in the event that the console
interface does not distinguish between them, e.g., slot-1
and the card in slot-1.
variables.name: ENTITY-MIB::entPhysicalName

description: The operate state for this object.

description: The h3cDiskIOErrorNotification indicates that a disk occurred I/O error.
A textual description of physical entity. This object
should contain a string that identifies the manufacturer's
name for the physical entity, and should be set to a
distinct value for each version or model of the physical
entity.

description: This object identifies if the array is hided. When the value of
this object is equal to 'enable', the array will be hided and the
files on it can not be accessed by any user.

description: The h3cRaidDegradeNotification indicates that a array state change.

description: The h3cDiskPowerOnNotification indicates that
a disk is power on.
A textual description of physical entity. This object
should contain a string that identifies the manufacturer's
name for the physical entity, and should be set to a
distinct value for each version or model of the physical
entity.
variables.name: ENTITY-MIB::entPhysicalDescr

description: The h3cDiskPowerOffNotification indicates that
a disk is power off.
A textual description of physical entity. This object
should contain a string that identifies the manufacturer's
name for the physical entity, and should be set to a
distinct value for each version or model of the physical
entity.
variables.name: ENTITY-MIB::entPhysicalDescr

description: This object describes the reason of disk poweroff.
The value 'environmentUnstable' means disk poweroff and may poweron again.
The value 'mediumError' means disk poweroff and never poweron.
The value 'smartCheckError' means disk's SMART check failed and poweroff.
The value 'generalError' means disk poweroff because of general error.
variables.name: H3C-DISK-MIB::h3cDiskPowerOffReason
